lines.name: Line 1: Kxf2 Main (Kf3)
lines.description: The main line where White takes on f2 and walks into the king hunt. Critical line for both sides.
lines.hint: After Ng5, Black sacrifices the bishop with Bc5-Bxf2+ to drag the white king forward!
lines.evaluation: Black gets excellent compensation and attacking chances

lines.name: Line 1.1: Kxf2 then Ke1
lines.description: White tries Ke1 to escape. Black gets excellent compensation with the rook on h1.
lines.hint: After Ke1, Black brings the queen to h4+ and wins the exchange on h1
lines.evaluation: Black has strong compensation for the piece

lines.name: Line 1.2: Kxf2 then Kf1
lines.description: Kf1 leads to complex tactics. Black maintains strong pressure with tactical shots.
lines.hint: Against Kf1, Black's queen goes to h4 and creates immediate threats

lines.name: Line 1.3: King Hunt (Ke2) - The Famous Mate!
lines.description: The famous king hunt! White's king gets mated in the center of the board. A masterpiece of tactics.
lines.hint: The white king takes a deadly walk across the board - one of the most beautiful tactical sequences in chess!
lines.evaluation: Forced mate for Black - the crown jewel of the Traxler!

lines.name: Line 1.4: Kxf2 then Ke3
lines.description: Ke3 is another try but Black gets excellent play with the centralized queen.
lines.hint: After Ke3, the black queen dominates the center and wins material

lines.name: Line 2: Kf1 Variation (Refusing the Bishop)
lines.description: If White refuses the bishop sacrifice with Kf1, Black gets a beautiful mating attack.
lines.hint: If White doesn't take the bishop, Black develops with Qe7 and gets a crushing attack
lines.evaluation: Forced mate for Black if White refuses the sacrifice

lines.name: Line 3: Bxf7+ Bishop Sacrifice
lines.description: White can try the bishop sacrifice instead. Black gets good compensation but it's more complex.
lines.hint: Against the bishop sacrifice, Black accepts with Ke7 and develops actively
lines.evaluation: Complex position with good compensation for Black

lines.name: Line 4: Quiet Retreat (Nf3)
lines.description: If White retreats quietly, Black gets excellent central control and attacking chances.
lines.hint: Against the quiet retreat, Black strikes in the center with d5!
lines.evaluation: Equal position with good play for Black

lines.name: Line 5: d4 Variation
lines.description: White can try d4 to open the center, but Black gets good piece play.
lines.hint: Against d4, Black takes and develops with good compensation
lines.evaluation: Approximately equal with active piece play

lines.name: Line 6: Nxf7 Declined - Nh3
lines.description: White can retreat to h3 to avoid complications. Black gets active piece play.
lines.hint: Against Nh3, Black seizes the center with d5 and gets excellent development
lines.evaluation: Good compensation for Black with active pieces

lines.name: Exercise 1: Basic Traxler Sacrifice
lines.description: White just played Ng5, attacking f7. How should Black respond with the Traxler Counter-Attack?
lines.hint: Sacrifice the bishop to deflect the king and attack e4! This is the signature Traxler sacrifice.
lines.instruction: The Traxler begins with a shocking bishop sacrifice to drag the white king forward.

lines.name: Exercise 2: Find the Correct King Move
lines.description: After 1.Nxf7 Bxf2+ 2.Kxf2 Nxe4+, White tries 3.Kf3. How should Black continue the attack?
lines.hint: Bring the queen into the attack with check! The white king is very exposed.
lines.instruction: After Kf3, Black brings the queen into the attack to hunt the white king.

lines.name: Exercise 3: King Hunt Continuation
lines.description: White played 3.Ke2 instead. Find Black's powerful continuation to start the famous king hunt!
lines.hint: Force the king forward with checks, then bring the queen into the attack! This is the start of the famous king hunt.
lines.instruction: Ke2 allows the most famous king hunt in chess history. Force the king into the center!

lines.name: Exercise 4: Alternative Defense - Kf1
lines.description: What if White doesn't take the bishop and plays 2.Kf1 instead of Kxf2?
lines.hint: If White refuses the bishop, develop the queen aggressively and attack the center!
lines.instruction: Against Kf1, Black gets excellent compensation by developing actively and striking in the center.

lines.name: Exercise 5: Quiet Defense Test
lines.description: White retreats the knight quietly with 3.Nf3 instead of capturing. How should Black respond?
lines.hint: If White retreats quietly, strike in the center immediately with d5!
lines.instruction: Against quiet moves, Black should seize the initiative with central action.

lines.name: Exercise 6: Bishop Sacrifice Alternative
lines.description: White tries the bishop sacrifice 3.Bxf7+ instead of Nxf7. How should Black respond?
lines.hint: Accept the sacrifice and develop actively! The bishop sacrifice is less dangerous than Nxf7.
lines.instruction: The bishop sacrifice leads to complex play but Black gets reasonable compensation.

lines.name: Exercise 7: Complete the King Hunt!
lines.description: You're in the middle of the famous king hunt. White's king is on e4, and you just played d5+. Complete the mating sequence!
lines.hint: The white king must walk to its doom! Continue with forcing checks to drive the king to a6 where it gets mated!
lines.instruction: This is the crown jewel of the Traxler - a forced mate with the king in the center of the board!

cards.question: What is the key move that starts the Traxler Counter-Attack?
cards.answer: Bxf2+! This bishop sacrifice deflects the white king and starts the attack.

cards.question: After 1.Nxf7 Bxf2+ 2.Kxf2 Nxe4+ 3.Ke2, what does Black play?
cards.answer: Nd4+! This starts the famous king hunt by forcing the white king forward.

cards.question: What happens if White plays Kf1 instead of taking the bishop on f2?
cards.answer: Black plays Qe7 and gets excellent compensation with a strong attack.

cards.question: In the king hunt line, where does the white king ultimately get mated?
cards.answer: On a6! The white king takes a famous walk across the board and gets mated in the corner.

cards.question: How should Black respond if White retreats quietly with Nf3?
cards.answer: d5! Strike in the center immediately and seize the initiative.
